meanings.definition: To be the main attraction or feature of something.
meanings.sent1: The bright fireworks headlined the Fourth of July celebration.
meanings.sent2: The new movie headlined the weekend box office.
meanings.sent3: The energetic puppy headlined the chaos in the house.
meanings.sent4: Her contagious laughter headlined the room, spreading joy to all.
meanings.sent5: The colorful parade headlined the town, drawing in crowds from all around.

meanings.definition: To provide a headline for a news article or story.
meanings.sent1: The editor headlined the breaking news about the storm.
meanings.sent2: The journalist headlined the front page with the latest political scandal.
meanings.sent3: The comedian headlined the newspaper with a joke of the day.
meanings.sent4: The reporter headlined the article with a shocking revelation.
meanings.sent5: The blogger headlined the blog post with an intriguing title to attract readers.
